revised_title: Effects of Vegetable Poisons on Vital Organs and Respiration
tldr: The author conducted experiments to understand how vegetable poisons affect the body, particularly the vital organs and respiration. They discovered that certain poisons, like oil from bitter almonds, can cause death by suspending respiration, which is dependent on the brain. The heart may continue to contract after apparent death, suggesting that poisons primarily affect the brain and the nervous system. The author also found that some poisons can be applied externally to cause similar effects, and they explored the possible mechanisms for this.
